The bags go in the back of a waiting SUBURBAN. Catfish ta the wheel. The crew climbs in, drives away.
ON JESSE. Absorbing this. His face begins to tremble. Eye press shut. They fill with moisture as he looks away. HOLD ON BUD. Quiet. Struggling to hide his own emotion.
I'm sorry...
And he walks out.
MOVING WITH BUD, as he heads for the exit. Under harsh fluorescents...

Pouring rain. It's a madhouse outside. A crowd is gathered around a pol action in progress. MEDICS are tending to the broken nose a bartender (PETE) in his 30s. METRO COP #1 stands by.  A car pulls up and Cobb gets out with Marandino. They approach the bartender.
(to Metro #1) He's out of his mind. 'Asked him to slow down; and he punched me in the face.
Cobb and Marandino approach.
(to bartender) Hey, Pete. You alright?
I'm alright. The bar ain't.
(to Metro #1) We'll smooth it out. Clear the street.
Cobb and Marandino start toward the bar.
The place is A MESS. Chairs broken, tables overturned. Mu BLARES on the jukebox. And empty except Bud... three shee to the wind, drunk. Pacing the ruins with his 9MM in hand
Y'all fuck with me? Huh? You want to fuck with me?
Cobb and Marandino peer in the doorway to see Bud, shouti and threatening a vacant chair.
Jesus Christ.
Bud flips another table. Continues talking to the chair a someone were in it.
'Look at me when I talk to you. (aims his 9MM) You try and kill me? You like killin' women and kids?
Bud holsters his gun and beats the shit out of the chair.
Bud...
Bud spins, glass-eyed and red-faced. His wavering vision barely make out Cobb and Marandino approaching...
Easy, Bud... Easy...
We got you here, Bud... It's just us. Hear me?
Bud stands his ground, tries to keep his balance...
Let's go home...
There's a long moment. Bud stares at his crew, gone. Then he's suddenly overwhelmed with emotion...
Two FBI AGENTS #4 and #5 walk together down this sterile corridor. They stop outside Jesse's closed door. A unifor POLICE OFFICER is posted there, reading a newspaper.
We're here to escort Mr. Wheeler.
(holds up a chart) Sign this.
FBI #4 signs the chart. The two agents enter...
Jesse's bed is empty. The window open. Curtains billowing
Check the bathroom.
FBI #5 opens the bathroom door. Empty. Both Agents hurry the window, SEE OUTSIDE: A large TREE six feet out from t ledge and a broken branch at street level. A seemingly impossible escape route.
Sonofabitch. This guy's crazy.
A badly hung-over Bud sits with Braddock, Fitch and numer agents around a conference table.
walks the room, says to all:

This is an atrocity, gentlemen. Incompetence at it's highest level. I gave you my name. My resources. My trust...Carte blanche. And now this handsome face of mine...can't step foot in Washington, for fear of being laughed off the Hill.
Nokes circles behind Bud...
Now, I'd love to point to Local on this. But truth is, they've carried their weight. We are federally fucked...  (looks right at Fitch) Because Federal fucked up.
Fitch wipes sweat, swallows hard.
So. Best idea wins, gentlemen. Chain of command? Point of procedure? I don't give a fuck. That's out the window, just like our informant...  (beat) I want Jesse Wheeler found.
As everyone files out. Braddock says low to Bud:
You smell like a fuckin' distillery, Bud. Clean up... 'find your boy.
ON BUD. Tired eyes. Everything else, and now this...

A metal door rises up. Jesse, in silhouette, steps in. A BARE BULB comes to light. Mottled with fly excrement. Jesse unlocks and opens several SAMSONITE SUITCASES. Stac in grey packing foam are rows and rows of GUNS. Jesse hefts his choices. Checking line and breach: A 12 G Shotgun. A Colt .357 Magnum. A Remington sawed-off with pistol grip. Les Baer Tactical .45. Glock Semi-auto 9MM. Knife. Duct tape. 5-Gallon gas cans. He loads up a gym ba Jesse pulls scissors from a grooming kit and stands befor grimy mirror. He cuts off his hair. Then using clippers, shaves his scalp and mustache.  Jesse yanks a tarp off a '75 beat-up Chrysler. Pops the trunk. Throws in the gym bag. Then drives away.
A lone, dilapidated HOUSE BOAT sits heavily in the bayou. Lights on inside. Dense FOG overlays.

Long-Hair on the couch, watching tv, drinking liquor. SPE METAL MUSIC blasts from a stereo somewhere. There's a METALLIC BANG O.S. Long-Hair looks up. The screen door rattles. Long-Hair grabs an aluminum bat, slowly approaching...
Who's there?
Sudden surprise as the screen SNAPS OFF and a SILHOUETTE breaks the glass, opens it.
What the fuck?!

Long-Hair RUSHES for the door as THE BUTT OF A 12-GAUGE S DOWN LIKE A TOMAHAWK. Long-Hair collapses with a shattered knee and muted screa Jesse steps in, racking the gauge with one hand, takes ai the helpless Long-Hair writhing on the floor.
The front lights go out. A terrible darkness.

A door flies open. Jesse, eyes darting, pushes Long-Hair Bandaged hand clamped to the collar. Shotgun at the neck. They move down a dark hallway. SPEED METAL throbs, growin LOUDER... Long-Hair, gash gushing, leg crunches with each step... They turn another hallway... Light spills from un a door, shadows behind it... Jesse edges Long-Hair forwar reaches the doorway, creeps through...

The door swings wide on the room, REVEALING: Buzz, on the bed, furiously fucking a dark-haired HOOKER, over a burea As Long-Hair rounds the corner... Buzz looks up, SEES Jes Dives for a gun. CHROME FLASHES. Everything EXPLODES at o The WALL DETONATES and Buzz goes down. Shocked. Choking. Blood juts from his side. He tries to get up. Can't. The HOOKER SCREAMS and cowers terrified in the corner. Jesse pumps, aims through the haze and fires again. Stere explodes. MUSIC CUTS OUT, plunging us into silence. Jesse tosses clothes to the Hooker.
Get out.
The Hooker does.
Two chairs. Buzz and Long-Hair back to back. Hands and fe tied. Blood spigoting. Jesse circles them with the shotgu The boat rocks gently.
We got some shit to discuss.
Buzz, to Jesse, unintimidated:
Ain't got nothin' to say to you, Wheeler.
(top of his lungs) I need a doctor! I need a fuckin' doctor!

In one motion, Jesse racks the shotgun, thrusts the barre Long-Hair's chin AND BLOWS HIS HEAD OFF. Buzz screams, REARS UP, chair collapses beneath him, DRAG a dead Long-Hair along the floor, still tied together.
FUCK! FUCK! OH, FUCK!
House call.
Jesse YANKS Buzz up. His chair rocks upright, into place.
Where's Lucian?!
I don't know!
Jesse punctuates, shotgun butt against Buzz's head. Neck snaps. Teeth rattle.
NO ONE KNOWS WHERE LUCIAN IS! NO ONE KNOWS-
Jesse strikes again, connects. Buzz goes down in a heap, swollen purple slits. His skull gushing red.
...fuck...
Jesse steps over Buzz, pins the shotgun to his jaw.
Who killed my family?
Ah shit, man!
Jesse shifts his aim an inch, pulls the trigger. SHOT REV HARD. Buzz SCREAMS, hysteria.
(racks another shell) WHO KILLED 'EM?! CATFISH?!
CATFISH, YES, YEAH! FUCKIN' CATFISH!
Jesse puts down the shotgun. Pulls from his gym bag, two OF GASOLINE, one of which, he splashes over Buzz's face.
(flinches) The fuck is that? (sniffs, realizes) WAIT, WAIT! WHAT ARE YOU DOIN'?!
Jesse pours the rest over Buzz and the lifeless Long-Hair
(thrashing) NO! NO, NO, NO, DON'T!! DON'T!!
As Buzz pleads for his life, Jesse unloads the shotgun, d aim...FIRES.

head_text.subj: THE MUZZLE FLASH. GASOLINE IGNITES. BUZZ GOES UP IN FLAME

text: Instantly, a FIRE ERUPTS. Buzz and Long-Hair's corpses BU Jesse empties the other can of gas, FEEDING THE FLAMES. T FIRE SPREADS. BURNING THE WALLS. THE FLOOR AND CEILING. Jesse stands there, the heat reflects the intensity in hi face. For a moment, it's a vision in hell.

Engulfed in flames. SIRENS and LIGHTS as FIRE TRUCKS and BOATS douse the burning boat with hard water. Among a crowd of SPECTATORS, the shaken Hooker is being questioned by Marandino. Bud and Cobb stand apart.
We've had a tap on Kiersey's line forty eight hours now. It's clean. Whatever's he's up to, Bud, it ain't comin' through the front door.
Bud starts leaving the scene. Suddenly FITCH and two AGEN barge forward.
Carter! We need to talk.
Get out of my way, Fitch.
(following Bud) This is my investigation. Jesse's cowboy bullshit is not how it's done!
While your agents build their cases and set for court, he'll erase the debt owed to all of you. Overnight.
So you're implying I should thank him?
Bud shakes his head in disgust, keeps walking...
Look, Carter, whether we like it or not, you and I have to work together on this. We entice Jesse back. I'll get him full protection, if he agrees to testify.
That'll never happen.
Why the hell not?!

(turns) 'Cause it's over, Fitch. It's done. He has nothing. Why do you think he lit that fire? To plant a flag. To let us know he doesn't need our protection. Doesn't want it. He would've just left 'em for dead.
For God sakes, listen to me! I'm not taking the fall for this! The plan is--

No, the truth is, Fitch, you ain't got balls big enough to relate to this guy. If you had listened to me, we wouldn't be in this situation. Jesse wouldn't be in this situation. And you wouldn't be askin' stupid fuckin' questions! (walking away) I'll bring him in myself. Just keep your agents off my ass.
Bud storms off.
Lynn stumbles through the woods, holding her baby. Scared Lost. Their skin bleached-out. Eyes hollow. Like appariti We're in a dream. A sadistic enhancement.
His family's image dissolves inside them. WIDEN to reveal Jesse before a cracked mirror in a SERVIC STATION BATHROOM. Perspiring, he re-bandages his hand as blood swirls down the drain.
An expensively dressed Kiersey emerges from a courtroom, flanked by a pair of well dressed AIDES.
Get back to the office. Follow up on the Arthur Bierce case. I need names and numbers on my desk by three pm.
The Aides scurry down another corridor, as Kiersey exits building through the glass front doors...

Kiersey moves to a parked Cadillac pops the trunk and set his briefcase inside, when... A RUSHING POV FROM BEHIND: Slams the trunk on Kiersey's h Kiersey SCREAMS, drops to his knees. His wrists wedged in trunk. And standing over him...is Bud.
OH, CHRIST! JESUS CHRIST! MY HANDS!
You know who I am?
OPEN THE TRUNK! PLEASE! OPEN THE TRUNK!
Bud kicks him in the stomach, doubles him over.
You know who the fuck I am?!
YES!
Who's Richard Morris?! Why was he killed?
No answer. Bud pounds on the trunk. Kiersey CRIES OUT.
I'll break every fuckin' bone you got. Start talkin'.
(hyperventilating) I can't-- I can't--
Bud slams both fists on the trunk. All his weight.
(off Kiersey's SCREAM) Can't what?! What can't you do?!
Bud, enraged, kicks Kiersey's ribs in. Again.
You piece of shit, talk!
(hysterical) He made Jesse...The investigation... Everything...
His family?
Everything! After that, he was just a loose end!
Bud opens the trunk. Kiersey crumbles to the ground, shak
Where's Lucian Adams?
I don't know!
Bud jams a foot in Kiersey's neck. Grabs his hands and be We HEAR bones snap.
Lucian's goin' down. You either go down together, or you give him to me.
(a mile a minute) I never talk to him directly! I swear, they page me--
Bud roughly searches Kiersey.
--Every night at five, for a six o'clock call! They page from different numbers!
Bud finds a PAGER on Kiersey's slacks, yanks it off. Then leans down with a smile, venomous:
You're a dead man, Kiersey.
Bud storms off. Kiersey on the ground, a trembling mess.

Catfish does a rail of meth off the counter. He lights a cigarette and sits down in a re-upholstered l boy where a TATTOO ARTIST is setting up...  Catfish proffers his forearm, displaying a row of notches (kills). And Tattoo Artist begins to outline two more...
'Bout out of room, Catfish. You best start collectin' scalps.
Catfish smugs. Drags on his cigarette... WHEN A SUDDEN GUNSHOT SPRAYS CATFISH WITH BLOOD. Tattoo Artist drops dead on the floor.
(looks up) What the fuck?!
Jesse, standing over Catfish. A .45 comes down twice fast with a CRACK! Catfish is knocked cold.
Bud, on police radio, driving high-speed.
What do you got?
Bud's VOICE over speaker phone. Marandino on the line wit sheaf of paperwork. Cobb enters.
He's in the French Quarter. All numbers paging Kiersey between five and six p.m., the last seventy-two hours, are pay phones within a three mile radius.
Alright.
Bud, you gotta talk to Braddock. He's lookin' for you, he's fuckin' pissed.
Hold him off. I'll square it with him when I get to the Quarter.
Bud punches the gas, traveling 90 mph.
CATFISH'S EYES blink awake - pinpoint dilated. WIDEN TO REVEAL he's stripped to his boxers, tied to the lazy-boy. And Jesse is seated beside him.
I'm gonna ask questions...
Jesse rolls a tattoo tray of various HARDWARE towards him Needles. Rusted pliers. An electric tattoo drill.
When I'm satisfied with your answers, I'm gonna kill you. How long it takes and how much blood you want to spill...that's up to you.
Catfish grins. A wide, Amphetamine smile.
What do you want to know? Want to hear about your brother? How we had him shot up with strychnine? How he died slow death?

Without warning, Jesse grabs the PLIERS. A flash of movem and there's a TERRIBLE SCREAM AS CATFISH'S FRONT TOOTH IS RIPPED OUT. He bucks violently in his chair. Jesse jams the DRILL into Catfish's gums, high speed. BLO SPRAYS. Loud, electric pain and Catfish CRIES OUT IN TERR Jesse sets down the drill, deadpan.
OH, YOU SONOFABITCH!!!
Four days ago, my wife and son were killed. (pause) I hear you took the contract?
Catfish smiles. Lips quivering with hate.
Forty-four pounds, Miznay-Schardin. Like you taught me. Fuck yeah, I took it. Blew your bitch and kid sky high.
Jesse grabs the pliers, YANKS another tooth. Catfish HOWL
MOTHERFUCKER!!!
BLOOD SPEWS as the drill digs in. Catfish SCREAMS. Jesse tosses teeth on the tray.
(thrashing wildly) OH, YOU'RE GONNA DIE! YOU'RE GONNA FUCKIN' DIE!
Jesse grabs Catfish's rapidly swelling jaw and yanks hard
Where's Lucian?

Jesse TIGHTENS his grip. Vice-like. Blood fills Catfish's mouth. He gurgles, then SPITS in Jesse's face...  ...FLASHES OF STEEL and two more teeth rip out at the roo Catfish SCREAMS then passes out. Jesse slaps him awake.
Where's he hidin' out?
Catfish, last ounce of spite, cracks a blackened grin:
Get fucked.

THE DRILL STRIKES. Bone deep. Gum line splays open. Teeth crack and split. Catfish SCREAMS UNCONTROLLABLY. Blacks o Jesse stops. A brief reprieve. He gets up and looks aroun the apartment. SEES: Magazines. A few revolvers. Empty li bottles. Meth on the counter. And on the stove:   A HYPODERMIC NEEDLE. Beside a pie tin, speed base boiling Jesse stares. He lowers the syringe into the tin, plunger drawing fluid... ...then very deliberately sticks Catfish's arm with the t of the needle, pops a cc.   Catfish bolts awake, EYES WIDE. A long, wet WHEEZE.
Where's Lucian?
Catfish's head lulls. Jesse grabs him by the hair. Leans
Where's Lucian?
(barely audible) New Orleans...
New Orleans. Where in New Orleans?
New Orleans...
Jesse looks Catfish dead in the eyes. And death is there. Begging.
(softly) I believe you.
With that, Jesse pushes the plunger down...ever...so...sl Blood burps and bubbles from Catfish's throat. Lungs conv and spasm. Eye go wide then roll back. A suicide dose.
JESSE'S CAR racing up I-10, along the roaring Mississippi toward a blood red horizon of a Louisiana sundown.
Cars line crowded streets in the heart of New Orleans.

TIGHT ON A DASHBOARD CLOCK: 5:04 p.m. Bud, waiting, parked outside a POLICE PRECINCT in the Low French Quarter. Kiersey's pager on the dash. Waiting. The THE PAGER BUZZES. Bud grabs it, hurries out to a nearby pay-phone. Dials...
(into phone) It's Bud. I got a number.

location: COMPUTER LAB, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRECINCT

text: Cobb on a database, phone cradled...
(types, searches) Governor Nicholls Wharf. Between St. Ann and Toulouse. You're a half mile south.
Get your ass down here.
Bud slams down the phone. Jumps in his car. Hits the gas.
A busy promenade near the down river end of the Mississip Bud waits low in his car, parked in a distant lot. Throug the windshield, WE SEE the subject of his surveillance...
on a crowded sidewalk. Faces pass. A Man in a JACKET arri at the phone. He waits. Checks his watch... ...Bud checks his clock: 6:10 The "Jacket" picks up the phone and dials...
Here we go.
Jacket waits. No call. Walks away. Bud FOLLOWS on foot...
A sprawling swirl of humanity, live jazz and bars. The Ja passes through. Twenty feet back, Bud keeps pace...
Jacket enters. Pumps coins into the PAY-PHONE. Dials...
(recording) You've reached the law offices of Daniel J. Kiersey--
Jacket hangs up. More coins. Another number...
(recording) Hello, you've reached the Kiersey residence. No one's home right now--
Jacket hangs up. Exits east onto BARRACKS STREET. Glances over his shoulder, then ahead, as Bud rounds the corner..
Jacket crosses into a LIQUOR STORE.  Bud stalls at the corner, casing the street. Takes everyt in. He reaches for his cigarettes, finds a crumpled back. Then crosses the street to...

outside the liquor store. Bud buys cigarettes and a newsp He opens the paper, glances at the headlines. At the same time, peers into the LIQUOR STORE WINDOW...  ...The Jacket walks toward the back of the store and out door to an ALLEY. Bud heads south on Decatur. Lights a cigarette, as he pas various stores on the block. A private two-story building with blacked out windows at the far end: "TIBEDAUX'S TAVE Bud turns into...
Lined with boutiques on one side. Back of Tibedaux's on t other. A cargo gate is up and MEN are hoisting crates int truck...   The Jacket is there, talking to them:
Should've been on the road twenty minutes ago. Hurry it up.
Bud pauses at a DRESS SHOP. Stares into the storefront gl reflecting the Jacket and Men...    Jacket walks off. Bud flicks his cigarette, enters...
...and peers out the window, watching the Jacket leave th alley and enter a FRENCH COLONIAL.
A SECURITY GUARD behind a desk. As Jacket walks in...
What's goin' on, Jack?

Jacket moves through a warren of CORRIDORS. Hardened MEN shuttle in and out of private offices. Plates on the door "Material Management." "Plating & Metal". "Demolition"... Jacket knocks on a door. Opens it to...
A bulked-out man at his desk... MILLS. Looks up as Jacket enters:
Talk to me.
Got nothin' to tell. Kiersey didn't call.
Try his office?
'Ain't there. His home neither.
Mills picks up the desk-phone. Dials...
(into phone) It's Mills. I need sweepers through Baton Rouge. Find Daniel Kiersey. (then to Jacket) Keep pagin' him.
Jacket exits the Colonial and enters a corner CAFE. INSID WE SEE Jacket move to a pay-phone and dial...
ON KIERSEY'S PAGER, as it BUZZES again.
now seated at the window of this second-story room, using BINOCULARS to case the surrounding perimeter.
C'mon. Show me somethin'.
POV THROUGH BINOCULARS: as the night comes alive. Trucks to and from the alley. Patrons valet and enter Tibedaux's
Braddock, walking down the hall with two POLICEMEN, unloc heavy door and enters...
...where Kiersey waits. Pale skin, beaded in sweat. Both hands in casts.
Mr. Kiersey. I'm Captain Mike Braddock. How can I help you?
Detective Bud Carter is out of control!
(corrects him) Detective "Lieutenant." Now how can I help you?
Kiersey, a shaky breath.
How long till you make an arrest in your investigation of Lucian Adams?
Braddock, just stares.
I'm willing to provide you with documents and information to secure his conviction.
Why?
Why do you think? I'm afraid for my life. (and the hammer) I'll confirm whatever Jesse Wheeler's given you.
AERIAL SHOT: LOOKING DOWN as a TOWN CAR circles the block
(radio filter) Got a possible here.
The TOWN CAR passes slow... REVEAL NOW: MARANDINO, staked having dinner outside the cafe. Crowded tables around him
(radio filter) Town Car. Black. Second time around.

MOVING WITH THE TOWN CAR, as it turns onto ESPLANADE AVEN and parks before the Colonial. REVEAL NOW: COBB, in a nondescript VAN. Parked a quarter block off Esplanade. He triggers photos through tinted gl STILL PHOTOS CLICK -- the Town Car doors open. Two AB SOLDIERS step out. Bulges where their holsters are. Then third man from in back: A boss, HAROLD KAY, 50s.
(into radio) Bud, you see this?
BUD'S POV THROUGH BINOCULARS: Kay escorted into the Colon
Parked on Chartres Avenue. Covering the alley. With binoculars, he can SEE the high point of the Colonial.  And we see now, Bud has this place surrounded.
(as a light goes on, into radio) They're on the second floor.
Bud grabs the phone. Dials...

location: CAPTAIN'S OFFICE, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRECINCT

text: Braddock on the line:
(over phone) It's Bud...
You better have something fuckin' good.
I'm in the French Quarter. Sittin' on AB activity.
Lucian?
Don't know yet. I got Harold Kay so far.
Braddock looks to the AB ORGANIZATIONAL CHART on the wall MUG SHOT of HAROLD KAY atop one branch of AB SOLDIERS.
Looks like they own the God damn block.
Well I got Kiersey just walked in. Two fractured wrists and scared as all hell.
I can explain--
He wants to make a deal, Bud. I can keep Nokes in the dark twenty-four hours, but that's it.
Cobb's VOICE comes over the radio:
(radio filter) Bud, we got movement.
(into phone) Hold on, Mike.
Bud cradles the phone, picks up the radio:
(into radio) Go ahead...
OUT THE BACK WINDSHIELD: A LINCOLN arrives at the cafe. C doors open... COBB CLICKS PHOTOS -- another boss emerges, EDGAR BINGHAM flanked by two more AB SOLDIERS.
(into radio) Holy shit.
BUD'S POV THROUGH BINOCULARS: Kay and Mills exit the Colonial. Bingham and Kay shake hands.
(radio filter) It's cookin', Bud. It's cookin' fast.
(into phone) Mike, I've got Edgar Bingham now. Just showed with two of his crew, for a sit down with Kay.
he scans the AB CHART again. MUG SHOT of HAROLD BINGHAM a another branch of AB SOLDIERS.
Bingham, Kay, Mills and two Soldiers start toward the CAF
(radio filter) Marandino, they comin' your way.
Marandino looks up from his table, to find this crew of m walking right for him. Marandino stares. A frozen moment.
Bud throws down his binoculars and takes up a .50 CALIBER BURROWS RIFLE, lays an eye on the SCOPE. BUD'S POV THROUGH THE SCOPE (MAGNIFIED): the cross-hairs Kay and Bingham moving toward Marandino...
(into radio) Got 'em.

The crew of men getting closer now, a few yards away... Marandino - heart racing - slides his Browning 9MM out an slips it onto the table, below his napkin, aims... ...When the crew abruptly turns and enters the cafe. Marandino exhales relief...
(radio filter) They're inside.
Bud sits back. Then:  KIERSEY'S PAGER BUZZES AGAIN. (The cafe number)
(grabs phone, to Braddock) Mike, I need Kiersey to place a call. Five minutes, or this opportunity's gone.
(into phone) Give me the number...

Bingham, Kay and Mills at a booth, sipping coffee. Two Soldiers guard the front and back doors.  Mills looks at Jacket, who waits by the pay-phone. Both noticeably on edge. Finally -- The PAY-PHONE RINGS.
(to Kay + Bingham) Excuse me.
He gets up, walks toward the phone. When Jacket answers, Mills takes the receiver from him.
(into phone) Yeah...

location: HALLWAY PHONE, EAST BATON ROUGE PARISH PRECINCT

text: A nervous Kiersey on the line. Braddock, Policemen nearby
(over phone) We've been pagin' you over two hours. Where the fuck you been?
I apologize. I've been tooth and nail with the D.A., in court, all day.
Everything good?
Everything's fine. Just lay low. Regular time tomorrow.
Mills hangs up. Kiersey turns. Pale. To Braddock:
Now get me protection.
Mills returns to the booth. Kay and Bingham look at him.
So?
All good. Let's eat.
Marandino watches as Bingham, Kay and Mills pull their co on and exit the cafe...
(into transmitter) Call went down.
BUD'S POV THROUGH THE SCOPE: watching as Bingham, Kay and Mills enter Tibedaux's Tavern.
(filter) Entering Tibedaux's Tavern...
A busy nightclub crowded wall-to-wall with PATRONS. FOLLOW Kay, Bingham and Mills, passing tables, greeting "connected" types... and through a far door into a back r
FOLLOW Marandino as he walks down the street, knocks on t back of the Van.
Cobb, now dressed in evening attire, throws open the door Marandino climbs in. They exchange transmitter for headse and Cobb leaves the van for the street...
Cobb approaches the front door, where a pair of large DOO stand.
Can we help you?
Just lookin' for a drink and a bite to eat.
Think you'll find what you're lookin' for across the street.   (gestures) Try the cafe.
Cobb stares at both Doormen #1 and #2, immovable forces.
Alright. Thanks.
BUD'S POV THROUGH BINOCULARS: Cobb leaves Tibedaux's and positions himself at an outdoor table in the cafe.
(radio filter) Negative at Tibedaux's. Can't walk in. What's our move?
(into radio) We wait.
waiting. Patrons empty out. Cars drive away.
He waits. And waits. And nothing happens. Finally:
(radio filter) I've got movement. Back alley...
POV THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD: Back of Tibedaux's. A BALCONY GUARD emerges with a rifle, posts.
(radio filter) Talk to me.
(into radio) I've got a man on the south balcony. Armed.
The door below opens and a second GUARD steps out, posts.
(into radio) Second man at the door now. Street level. Possibly armed.

head_text.subj: SUDDENLY HEADLIGHTS FLOOD MARANDINO'S REAR WINDSHIELD.

text: Marandino ducks, a reflex action.
Lights from a CADILLAC and a GRAND MARQUIS appear and com down the street - past Cobb - SLOWLY. Blacked out windows
POV THROUGH WINDSHIELD: as the cars turn into the alley..
(into radio) A Cadillac and a Grand Marquis, just pulled in the alley.

...and stop behind Tibedaux's.  Passenger doors of both cars open, two AB SOLDIERS emerge They open the rear door of the Cadillac and shadow the ma they're escorting: LUCIAN. Balcony Guard looks on as Door Guard allows Lucian and hi Soldiers to enter the building.
(tense, into radio) Bud... we got Lucian Adams...
Bud, pulse building to a boil.
(into radio) Hold position. Give me a head count.
(filter) Two men flanking. Drivers have not left the cars. Initial perps still on post. Lucian's entering the building...
Bud pulls on a KEVLAR VEST, holsters a .45. Extra clips o the waistband. Checks a loaded PUMP SG. Ready.

Marandino, fastens on a vest, loads a 12-Gauge, locks. Suddenly, through the side window... A LONE FIGURE, IN A QUARTER TRENCH, MOVES PAST. It happens in a flash. Marandino LOOKS, SEES only a quick profile as the Figure between parked cars and walks across the street...
(into radio) I need eyes on a single, white male crossing Esplanade. Possible intent...
Cobb looks over his shoulder, SEES the Figure 75 yards aw moving briskly across Esplanade... We still can't see his face.
Bud grabs the rifle, eye on the scope, aims out the windo POV THROUGH THE SCOPE: as the CROSS-HAIRS find the Figure walking. SEE the BODY. Then the FACE... IT'S JESSE.  ON BUD, spinning now.
(beat, into radio) It's Jesse...
(quickly, radio filter) He's heading toward the alley, Bud. We take him down?
HEAD - TRACKING - RACK FOCUS... This decision... He HAS t decide... And he does:
Let him go.
What?!
(firm) Let him go.
Bud, that's crazy! Jesse goes in first, he's gonna blow this whole thing. We can't let that happen.
(intense, into radio) That's exactly what we're gonna do! We got no way inside. Let Jesse go in hard and draw fire. He pushes Lucian out to us. Stand the fuck down. I'm on my way.
Bud throws down the rifle, grabs the pump SG, runs out th door...
Marandino, sweeps the alley with his binoculars. No Jesse
(into radio) I don't see him. I got nothin'...
POV THROUGH BINOCULARS: (PAN UP) to the balcony. MUZZLE FLASHES SUDDENLY IGNITE. Balcony Guard is shot dead.
Fuck!

JESSE STRIDES INTO VIEW. Draws a silenced Tactical .45 an FIRES, putting TWO HARD ROUNDS into Door Guard. Both DRIV get out. Jesse pivots, HAMMERS two rounds to their heads. They drop cold. It happens in seconds.
(into radio) Shots fired! Shots fired!
Bud, charging through a FIRE EXIT, bounding down steps...
(over radio) Jesse hit four men! What do you want me to do?!
(into radio) Call it in! Local and SWAT! Get the place surrounded!
Jesse slaps a clay plastique with a DETONATOR onto Tibeda back door, then covers.   There's a loud EXPLOSION as the DOOR BLOWS OPEN.
FOLLOW JESSE through billowing smoke, into...
as he pulls a REMINGTON SAWED-OFF, slung on a strap, to h left hand, .45 to his right. Mid-hall, AB #6 looks over, freezes.
Lucian with Kay and Bingham. They HEAR the explosion. Exchange looks.
Jesse steps over the dead AB #6 without breaking stride. Comes to a door. Kicks it in...

...And Mills FIRES a gun, burning Jesse's ear -- Blood po down his neck -- and Jesse's Tactical FIRES. Mills is HIT IN THE THROAT. He falls into a chair. And hi eyes - at the fierce face of death - are filled with Jess who FIRES TWO ROUNDS. One to the head. That fast.
Two AB SOLDIERS #7 and #8 hurry in. Lucian, Kay and Bingh stand up.
Let's go. We're gettin' you out of here.
All three bosses draw GUNS. Lock and load.
Outside, the sound of gunfire is heard. Jacket turns to t BARKEEP. Alarmed:
Give me that fuckin' shotgun!
Barkeep lays a shotgun on the bar. Jacket reaches. When..
(boaring in, 9MM aimed) POLICE! TAKE YOUR HANDS OFF THE GUN! STEP FUCKIN' BACK!!
Jacket looks at Cobb. Steps back. Hands in the air.
Bud bursts outside, full throttle. Shouts into the radio:
Jam the alley! No one goes in or out!
Marandino hits the gas. TIRES SCREECH as he slides sidewa and secures the mouth of the alley. Door kicks out. 12-ga levels.
Doorman #1, HEARING the commotion turns... ...SEES INSIDE THE CAFE, Cobb cuffing Jacket and Barkeep. Doorman #1 draws a Para-Ordnance .45, FIRES. A VOLLEY OF

Cobb can't make it through INCOMING FIRE and covers. Remaining PATRONS SCREAM, drop under tables.   Doorman #1 KEEPS FIRING, advancing towards the Cafe, when BOOM! A SHOTGUN BLAST takes his head off -- REVEALING BUD behind him, running toward Tibedaux's.
PATRONS stampede for the door. Lucian, Bingham and Kay wi AB #7 and #8 follow...

Fluorescent units explode, plunging us into DARKNESS. Arc SPUTTER and FLARE, the corridors now strobe-lit.

AB #10 and #11 run out and swing their SMGs, FIRING onto alley and KILLING MARANDINO... Then charging to the front COBB FIRES. AB #10 is BLOWN APART, as AB #11 FIRES back, hitting Cobb in the vest. His ribs broken, he sits down stunned.
(into radio) I'm hit. I'm fuckin' hit.

Bingham rounds the bar just as Jesse, somehow, lifts the and FIRES two slugs into Bingham's chest. Bingham collapses on top of Jesse. The .45 hits the floor Both men, bleeding profusely, thrash along the floor...

out of nowhere. JESSE COLLAPSES, A BUNDLE OF TWITCHING NERVES, BLOOD POOLING FAST OUT THE BACK OF HIS HEAD... ...AND LUCIAN STANDS OVER HIM, HIS .357 SMOKING. Lucian turns slow. Toward a cracked MIRROR. Suddenly...

Bud flips Lucian over, rips the gun away. Lucian tries to break free. Bud grabs him - smashes the gun over and over against Lucian's face. Lucian's head BOUNCES. Eyes roll, then right. Bud tackles him into a table, which goe down. A chair breaks. Bud lands a thunderous hook and Lucian's nose shatters. Another and his cheekbone caves. Lucian drops like a rock. Tries to crawl under another ta IN A MANIACAL RAGE, Bud flips the table and stomps down o Lucian with furious blows that come one after another. Lucian tries to cover up. BUD IS ALL OVER HIM. Grabs Luci by the throat and presses down. Lucian, fighting to breathe, digs his nails into Bud's fa tearing skin.  Bud's face twists with hate as he chokes the life out of Lucian's eyes BULGE...His mouth stretches WIDE...clutchin Bud's fingers, trying to pull away... Bud SNORTS, tightens his grip... bearing down... And at t last moment, the cop in him reemerges... Bud lets go. Lucian rolls to his side and coughs up a thick ribbon of blood and vomit. Bud slams on restraints. Bud staggers to his feet...breathing hard...Spots Jesse o the floor...And he slows... Jesse lies in shadow. Perfectly still. We cannot see his Only the dark pool of blood around him. Lucian passes out.
(into radio) I got him... I got Lucian.

head_text.subj: SLOWLY PULL AWAY AND TRACK OVER THE MASSACRE...

text: ...as POLICE come in...over bodies and blood and guns, an the stairs and out a broken window, to the CROWDS in the street held back by POLICE, past flashing lights and emergency vehicles...  ...to where life goes on in New Orleans.
The sun is out. The sky above is clear.
